sentences.sContent: Check the tiles carefully before you buy them.
sentences.sCn: 购买之前要把瓷砖仔细检查一下。

sentences.sContent: A first rule in solving any mystery is to check the facts.
sentences.sCn: 揭开谜团的第一条规则是核查事实。

sentences.sContent: Fill in the cash book carefully and always check your calculations.
sentences.sCn: 仔细填写现金账簿，每次都要检查计算结果。

sentences.sContent: Positive test results are double-checked (= looked at twice ) to make absolutely sure.
sentences.sCn: 对呈阳性的化验结果要进行复查，以确保绝对准确。

sentences.sContent: ...One simple check would be to program a robot to check the correct course of action with a human when presented with an unusual situation...
...Make sure you check in with your opponents so that they are not carrying the emotion of the battles beyond the battle field...

...RelayRides and SnapGoods match up owners and renters; smartphones with GPS let people see where the nearest rentable car is parked; social networks provide a way to check up on people and build trust; and online payment systems handle the billing...
...but that only leaves me thirty minutes to clear customs in getting to the city center and it means I have to check in by five thirty...
...you should check what you have written...
...But check out the cost if renting an apartment first...
...He is healthy at least, comes into a clinic for a check regularly...
...and even conducts a reality check with some patients...
...saying he’s come to check that all their appliances are safe...
...Did you check that pile of journals you’ve borrowed from the library the other day...

words.tran: 检验员；收银员；棋子；方格图案；制止者
检查（check的过去式和过去分词）
把…画成棋盘形方格图案；使多样化

trans.tranOther: to do something in order to find out whether something really is correct, true, or in good condition
the process of finding out if something is safe, correct, true, or in the condition it should be
